ca.ualbert.cs.tasko.data

Class DataManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualbert.cs.tasko.data.DataManager

  • public class DataManager
extends java.lang.Object
    The DataManager class is built to provide an abstraction to elastic search functionality. This class provides a singleton interface with various methods to provide a simple way to store and retrieve data from the elastic search index.
    See Also:
    ca.ualbert.cs.tasko.Commands.DataCommands, DataCommandManager

      • getUserById

        public User getUserById(java.lang.String id)
                 throws NoInternetException
        Given a userID, attempt to retrieve a User object from elastic search based on the provided UUID string.
        Parameters:
        id - UUID of the desired user
        Returns:
        The user found on the database or an empty user if not found.
        Throws:
        NoInternetException - when the device has no internet.
        See Also:
        GetUserByIdCommand

      • getUserByUsername

        public User getUserByUsername(java.lang.String username)
                       throws NoInternetException
        Given a username, attempt to retrieve a User object from elastic search based on the provided username.
        Parameters:
        username - username of desired user
        Returns:
        The found user or an empty user if not found
        Throws:
        NoInternetException - when the device has no internet.

      • putTask

        public void putTask(Task task)
             throws NoInternetException
        Given a task, add it to the elasticSearch Database or update it if it already exists. If the task belongs to the logged in user. Add it to local task save as well. If the task is not the logged in users and the device is offline, throw an exception
        Parameters:
        task - task to be added
        Throws:
        NoInternetException - when not connected to the internet and the task is not the current logged in user.

      • deleteTask

        public void deleteTask(Task task)
                throws NoInternetException
        Given a task with a non-null id, execute the command to remove that task from the elastic search database.
        Parameters:
        task - task to be deleted
        Throws:
        NoInternetException

             throws NoInternetException
        Given a taskID, attempt to retrieve the task object from elastic search based on the provided UUID string.
        Parameters:
        taskId - UUID of the desired task
        Returns:
        the found task object or null if not found
        Throws:
        NoInternetException

      • searchTasks

        public TaskList searchTasks(java.lang.String searchTerm)
                     throws NoInternetException
        Given a string containing search terms, attempt to get the first 100 tasks from elastic search who's description contains all the terms in the searchTerm string.
        Parameters:
        searchTerm - string containing terms to search for in the description of a task
        Returns:
        a TaskList of all tasks who's description contains all terms in searchTerm
        Throws:
        NoInternetException - when not connected to the internet.

      • getTasksByLatLng

        public TaskList getTasksByLatLng(java.lang.Double lat,
                                 java.lang.Double lng)
                          throws NoInternetException
        Given two doubles representing latitude and longitude. The method queries elastic search and returns all tasks within one lat/lon degree of the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        lat - Latitude
        lng - Longitude
        Returns:
        All tasks within one degree of lat, lon
        Throws:
        NoInternetException - When the device is not connected.

      • getUserTasks

        public TaskList getUserTasks(java.lang.String userId)
                      throws NoInternetException
        Given a userID, attempt to get all the tasks that have the requesterID matching the provided userId.
        Parameters:
        userId - userID of the user who's tasks are requested
        Returns:
        TaskList of the tasks containing userId as the requesterID
        Throws:
        NoInternetException
